info.title: 16Arena API 1.0
info.description: Initial version of the 16Arena API with core mobile functionality.

post.summary:
Creates a new API key. Raw key is returned only once.
Requires: apikeys.create permission.
Only tenant Admin can create (for their own tenant). SuperAdmin cannot create.
API keys never expire by default (can only be revoked). All permissions from the codebase are assigned automatically.
post.description:
API Version: 1.0

⚠️ **DEPRECATED**: This version is deprecated. Please upgrade to v2 or later for better performance and features.

Rate Limiting: 100 requests per minute per IP address

get.summary:
Lists API keys. Requires: apikeys.view permission.
Admin: own tenant only. SuperAdmin: any tenant (pass tenantId).
get.description:
API Version: 1.0

⚠️ **DEPRECATED**: This version is deprecated. Please upgrade to v2 or later for better performance and features.

Rate Limiting: 100 requests per minute per IP address

delete.summary:
Revokes an API key.
Access is controlled purely by the apikeys.revoke permission policy.
delete.description:
API Version: 1.0

⚠️ **DEPRECATED**: This version is deprecated. Please upgrade to v2 or later for better performance and features.

Rate Limiting: 100 requests per minute per IP address

post.summary:
Imports tournament participants from a third-party system.
Creates or updates users and teams based on external IDs, and registers them to the specified tournament.
post.description:
This endpoint allows third-party clients to:
- Import players with their external IDs
- Import teams with players
- Automatically register them to a tournament

For team tournaments, provide the `teams` array with players inside each team.
For solo tournaments, provide the `players` array directly.

External IDs are unique per tenant, allowing each third-party client to use their own ID scheme.
If an entity with the same ExternalId already exists, it will be updated instead of created.

Entry fees are skipped for external imports (treated as pre-paid).

API Version: 1.0

⚠️ **DEPRECATED**: This version is deprecated. Please upgrade to v2 or later for better performance and features.

Rate Limiting: 100 requests per minute per IP address

requestBody.description: The import request containing tournament ID and participant data.

200.description: Import completed (check Success field and Errors for details).

get.summary:
Validates an invitation token without accepting it.
Use this to show invitation details before the user accepts.
get.description:
This endpoint is public and does not require authentication.

Response will indicate:
- Whether the invitation is valid
- Tenant and role information
- Whether the user needs to create an account (needsRegistration)

API Version: 1.0

⚠️ **DEPRECATED**: This version is deprecated. Please upgrade to v2 or later for better performance and features.

Rate Limiting: 100 requests per minute per IP address

post.summary: Accepts an invitation and creates/updates the user account.
post.description:
This endpoint is public because the user might not have an account yet.

Flow:
1. If user exists with the invited email → assigns them to the tenant
2. If user doesn't exist → creates a new account automatically

After accepting:
- New users should complete their profile and log in
- Existing users should log in again to get updated JWT with tenant info

API Version: 1.0

⚠️ **DEPRECATED**: This version is deprecated. Please upgrade to v2 or later for better performance and features.

Rate Limiting: 100 requests per minute per IP address

post.summary: Declines an invitation.
post.description:
This marks the invitation as declined so the inviter knows the user
actively chose not to join.

API Version: 1.0

⚠️ **DEPRECATED**: This version is deprecated. Please upgrade to v2 or later for better performance and features.

post.summary:
Creates a new invitation.
Requires: tenant.invite permission.
post.description:
The response includes the invitation token. Use this token to build the invitation URL:
https://yourapp.com/invite?token={token}

The token should be sent to the invited user via email.

API Version: 1.0

gameId.description: Gets or sets the game ID.

userGameId.description: Gets or sets the user's game ID (in-game username or player ID).

SixteenArena.WebAPI.Controllers.CreateUs.description: Request DTO for creating a user game ID.

transactionId.description: Gets or sets the transaction ID to reverse.

reason.description: Gets or sets the reason for reversal.

SixteenArena.WebAPI.Controllers.ReverseT.description: Request DTO for reversing a transaction.

amount.description: Gets or sets the amount to credit.

categoryCode.description: Gets or sets the category code (only referral_bonus, achievement_unlock allowed).

referenceId.description: Gets or sets the reference ID.

referenceType.description: Gets or sets the reference type.

idempotencyKey.description: Gets or sets the idempotency key.

SixteenArena.WebAPI.Controllers.SelfCred.description: Request DTO for self-credit operations (limited categories).

gameId.description: Gets or sets the game ID.

userGameId.description: Gets or sets the user's game ID (in-game username or player ID).

SixteenArena.WebAPI.Controllers.UpdateUs.description: Request DTO for updating a user game ID.

password.description:
Gets or sets the password that the user wants to use
for their new account when accepting the invitation.
For existing users, this can be omitted.

token.description: Gets or sets the invitation token from the invitation link.

username.description:
Gets or sets the optional username for the new account.
If not provided, a username will be generated from the email.

displayName.description: Gets or sets the optional display name for the new account.

permissionId.description:
Gets or sets the permission ID to add.
Use GET /api/v1/admin/tenant/roles/permissions/available to get valid IDs.

SixteenArena.WebAPI.Models.Requests.AddP.description: Request to add a permission to a role.

userId.description: Gets or sets the user ID to assign the role to.

roleId.description: Gets or sets the role ID to assign.

SixteenArena.WebAPI.Models.Requests.Assi.description: Request to assign a role to a user.

email.description: Gets or sets the email address to invite.

roleId.description: Gets or sets the role to assign when the invitation is accepted.

message.description: Gets or sets an optional personal message to include in the invitation.

expirationDays.description: Gets or sets how many days until the invitation expires (default: 7).

SixteenArena.WebAPI.Models.Requests.Crea.description: Request to create a new tenant invitation.

name.description: Gets or sets the name of the role.

description.description: Gets or sets the description of the role.

permissionIds.description:
Gets or sets the list of permission IDs for this role.
Use GET /api/v1/admin/tenant/roles/permissions/available to get valid IDs.

SixteenArena.WebAPI.Models.Requests.Crea.description: Request to create a new tenant role.

permissionId.description: Gets or sets the permission ID to remove.

SixteenArena.WebAPI.Models.Requests.Remo.description: Request to remove a permission from a role.

userId.description: Gets or sets the user ID to unassign the role from.

SixteenArena.WebAPI.Models.Requests.Unas.description: Request to unassign a role from a user (revert to default role).

name.description: Gets or sets the new name (optional).

description.description: Gets or sets the new description (optional).

permissionIds.description:
Gets or sets the new permission IDs (optional).
Use GET /api/v1/admin/tenant/roles/permissions/available to get valid IDs.

SixteenArena.WebAPI.Models.Requests.Upda.description: Request to update a tenant role.

isNewUser.description:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is a new user account.
If true, the user needs to set up their profile.

message.description: Message to display to the user.

success.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the API request was successful.

message.description: Gets or sets a message describing the result of the API request.

errorCode.description: Gets or sets the machine-readable error code when an error occurs.

meta.description: Gets or sets metadata such as pagination, traceId, timings, etc.

errorCode.description: Gets or sets the machine-readable error code when an error occurs.

meta.description: Gets or sets metadata such as pagination, traceId, timings, etc.

SixteenArena.WebAPI.Models.Responses.Api.description: Represents a standardized API response with generic data.

token.description:
The invitation token. Include this in the invitation URL.
Format: https://yourapp.com/invite?token={Token}

invitationUrl.description: A pre-built invitation URL (requires frontend URL to be configured).

SixteenArena.WebAPI.Models.Responses.Cre.description: Response for a created invitation (includes the raw token).

id.description: Gets or sets the permission ID.

name.description: Gets or sets the permission name (e.g., "tournaments.manage").

description.description: Gets or sets the description of the permission.

isActive.description: Gets or sets whether the permission is active.

SixteenArena.WebAPI.Models.Responses.Ten.description: Response model for a tenant member (user within a tenant) with basic details and role.

members.description: Gets or sets the list of active members in the tenant.

invitations.description: Gets or sets the list of invitations (pending users) for the tenant.

SixteenArena.WebAPI.Models.Responses.Ten.description: Combined response for tenant members and invited users.

SixteenArena.WebAPI.Models.Responses.Use.description: Response for user info in invitation context.

Bearer.description: JWT Bearer token. Use for user authentication.
Bearer.name: Authorization
